alert.note: Alert for Muskogee; Okmulgee; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rogers, western Wagoner, northern Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee and southeastern Tulsa Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1045 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tulsa to 4 miles south of Bixby to 2 miles east of Okfuskee. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Okmulgee... Bixby... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Catoosa... Verdigris... Haskell... Inola... Beggs... Preston... Jenks Riverside Airport... Stonebluff... Bald Hill... Tulsa International Airport... Okmulgee State Park... Taiwah... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 222 and 259. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
